intro: Bunium rhodocephalum, commonly known as the red-headed fennel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic, often finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its seeds are small and oval, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Bunium rhodocephalum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
